column4: I'm running ubuntu 10.04 LTS. My microphone is not working. My speakers works fine. Anyone can help me to fix that please?
go to Sound Prefs, into INPUT tab
the input device selected is already my microphone
check if its not muted, or did you selected proper mic input
no it is not muted and proper mic is selected
isnt it muted or misselected mic?
no it is not muted and I have selected the right microphone
does the Input level "slider" moves when you speek?
do you have built in mic, or external?
that might be the problem - webCam acts as a second AudioCard
on input tab do you have selected WebCam as Input device?
on the sound preferences window, in the input tab, I can choose between 2 device «Internal audio analog stereo»  and «my webcam». My webcam is the selected one actually.
check on Device Tab the profile of selected Device - it might be wrong
you are talking about device tab ... in the sound preferences windows, I've those tabs «sound effects-Hardware-Input-Output-Applications»
in the input tab, the webcam is selected
in hardware tab, for the webcam, about the settings properties, I can choose either «analog mono input» or «off»
